text:
Below is an invalid schema that the parser accepts without raising errors.  
Schema components from the "schema" namespace (which has been given a namespace 
prefix "xd") have the namespace prefix "bad" that corresponds to another 
namespace declared in this schema document.

Schema:  3_14si42.xsd
=====================
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<bad:schema xmlns:xd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"
	targetNamespace="http://www.schemaTest.org/3_14si42"
	xmlns:sv="http://www.schemaTest.org/3_14si42"
    	xmlns:bad="http://bad.com/">
	
<bad:simpleType name="strLength">
	<bad:restriction base="xd:string">
		<xd:length value="5"/>
	</bad:restriction>
</bad:simpleType>

<xd:simpleType name="dstrLength">
	<xd:restriction base="sv:strLength">
		<bad:length value="5"/>
	</xd:restriction>
</xd:simpleType>

<bad:complexType name="strRoot">
	<bad:sequence>
		<bad:element name="elstrLength" type="sv:strLength"/>
		<bad:element name="eldstrLength" type="sv:dstrLength"/>		
		<bad:element name="elstrListB" type="string"/>
	</bad:sequence>
</bad:complexType>

<bad:element name="root" type="sv:strRoot"/>

</bad:schema>


Instance:  3_14si42.xml
=======================
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<dv:root xmlns:dv="http://www.schemaTest.org/3_14si42"
	xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
	xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.schemaTest.org/3_14si42
	3_14si42.xsd">

	<elstrLength>Five*</elstrLength>
	<eldstrLength>12345</eldstrLength>
	<elstrListB>1 2 Three Four End</elstrListB>

</dv:root>
creator: nddelima@ca.ibm.com
sandygao@ca.ibm.com
text: check the prefix for schema elements
